line_1: And deep imbibes the bloody, damning faith.
line_2: Which yields to all the holy juggler saith,
You rev'rence what the Parson saith;

line_1: Till Indignation sleeps away to Faith,
line_2: And GOD's own Pow'r and Peace take root in sacred Wrath.
Nor look askew at what it saith:

line_1: To Night I'll bring it, by my Faith;
line_2: Believe for once what Satan saith.

line_1: "Where commerce shelter'd flows thro' publick faith,
line_2: "Where freedom sleeps secure from lawless wrath,

line_1: This tender heart of purest faith
line_2: May then resign thee with its breath;

line_1: Hear how he clears the points o' Faith
line_2: Now meekly calm, now wild in wrath,

line_1: Many Folk, are uneasy concerning their Faith:
line_2: I'm sorry to find at the City of Bath,

line_1: Divest us of our cheated faith!
line_2: Ah! could we there with as slight skathe
